Event.name: Corroding
Event.definition: <def-root>In this frame the <fen>Patient</fen>, an inorganic item, undergoes a chemical process which renders it less useful, desirable or stable. <ex></ex> <ex> <fex name="Patient">The bike</fex> <t>rusted</t>. </ex><ex><fex name="Patient">The metal</fex> <t>corroded</t> <fex name="Result">into a mass of slime</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The bikes</fex> <t>rusted</t> <fex name="I-state">from their former beauty</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_state
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Initial_state</fen> is the original state of the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>The bikes <t>RUSTED</t> <fex name="I-state">from their former beauty</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifes the <fen>Duration</fen> of time for which the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Explanation</fen> for which the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of the change of phase. <ex>The metal <t>corroded</t> <fex name="Result"> into a mass of slime </fex> . </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Patient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change. <ex><fex name="Patient">The bikes</fex> <t>rusted</t> from their former beauty.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.</def-root>

Arg.name: Subregion
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> describes which part of a larger whole is being affected. <ex>The metal <t>rusted</t> <fex name="sub">around the edges </fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Speed</fen> at which the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: corrode.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be destroyed or damaged (metal or other hard material) slowly by chemical action.

lexUnit.name: oxidize.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to become combined with oxygine resulting in corrosion
